name: ATM Jackpotting DFIR 2025
description: MITRE ATT&CK layer for ATM jackpotting incident investigated by Thai Cyber Police, 2025. Sub-techniques are marked as possible (score 80) based on typical ATM jackpotting methods (malware, black-box devices) due to limited details in the source article.

techniques.comment: Exploiting vulnerabilities in ATM software or network interfaces remotely, a common initial access method in jackpotting.
Possible use of spearphishing attachments to compromise bank networks, enabling remote ATM access (seen in similar attacks like Cosmos heist).
Possible use of spearphishing links to deliver malware to bank employees, facilitating network access to ATMs.
Possible use of Windows Command Shell by malware (e.g., Ploutus.D, Tyupkin) to issue cash dispense commands on Windows-based ATMs.
Possible use of Visual Basic scripts by malware to control ATM operations, common in jackpotting malware.
Possible addition of malware to Registry Run Keys or Startup Folder for persistence on ATM reboot.
Switching ATM to supervisor mode to control cash dispensers, a core jackpotting technique.
Possible deletion of logs or malware files to remove evidence from ATM systems.
Possible hiding of malware files or use of mineral oil/wax to block ATM cameras to conceal activities.
Possible automated collection of transaction logs or cardholder data, though primary goal is cash dispensing.
Possible use of HTTP/HTTPS by black-box devices to communicate with attackersâ€™ smartphones or servers.
Possible corruption of ATM logs or software to cover tracks, common in jackpotting attacks.
Displaying 'Out of Service' on ATM screens to avoid suspicion during attacks, a confirmed tactic in jackpotting.
